intro: Hemitelia heterochlamydea, commonly known as the variable-leaved hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that vary in shape and size, and its small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, red berries that are dispersed by birds. Hemitelia heterochlamydea is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
